oai_dc:dc.dc:descriptions: Concerning certain Kafirs from the northern side of the Orange River. (L VIII.27. 8387
8390). The black people ('Kafirs') in |hanâ‰ kass'o's country live to the north (or the 'other side') of the Orange River. He calls them 'Kaal Kafirs' and describes some of their customs and doings.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Others living north of the Orange River
